articles.title: Decorated Indian officer arrested for Kashmir rebel ties
articles.description: SRINAGAR, India (AP) — Police in Indian-controlled Kashmir have arrested a long-serving counterinsurgency officer for allegedly having ties with rebels fighting against Indian rule in the disputed region, officials said Sunday.
articles.content:

articles.author: By MIKE SCHNEIDER Associated Press
articles.title: Not on form, but brawl over citizenship question continues
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court decided a citizenship question won't be on this spring's census form, but that doesn't mean the fight over it has ended in courtrooms across the country.
articles.content:
The U.S. Supreme Court decided a citizenship question won't be on this spring's census form, but that doesn't mean the fight over it has ended in courtrooms across the country.

articles.title: Canadian province retracts warning of nuclear power incident
articles.description: TORONTO (AP) — The Canadian province of Ontario sent an alert Sunday reporting an unspecified “incident” at a nuclear plant — only to later report the message was sent in error.
articles.content:
TORONTO (AP) The Canadian province of Ontario sent an alert Sunday reporting an unspecified incident at a nuclear plant only to later report the message was sent in error.
The initial message said the incident had occurred at the Pickering Nuclear Generating… [+360 chars]

articles.title: Maine's hemp farmers want to grow their biz, but rules loom
articles.description: PORTLAND, Maine (AP) — Hemp growers in Maine are concerned that new rules governing the crop could hold back the growth of an industry that is already the largest in New England.

articles.title: Italian fashion world adopts manifesto promoting diversity
articles.description: MILAN (AP) — The Italian National Fashion Chamber is promoting a diversity agenda among Milan’s major fashion houses, a year after several top Italian brands faced criticism for designs and remarks seen as culturally and racially insensitive.

articles.author: By JOHN PYE AP Sports Writer
articles.title: Djokovic beats Nadal, forcing doubles decider for ATP Cup
articles.description: SYDNEY (AP) — Novak Djokovic has extended his supremacy on hardcourts against Rafael Nadal to force a deciding doubles encounter for the inaugural ATP Cup.
articles.content:
Djokovic held for a 2-0 lead, the game going to deuce, and then didn't concede a point on serve for his next three games, closing the set in 39 minutes with three straight aces.

articles.title: Queen attends church on eve of meeting over Harry and Meghan
